snippet: Niger’s president, Mahamadou Issoufou, said that Afghan and Pakistani jihadis were training recruits for Islamist groups in northern Mali.
abstract: Niger’s president Mahamadou Issoufou says he has evidence that Boko Haram, an Islamist group that has become a security threat in Nigeria’s north and fostered links with Al Qaeda’s North African wing, was running training camps in Mali.
lead_paragraph: Niger’s president, Mahamadou Issoufou, said that Afghan and Pakistani jihadis were training recruits for Islamist groups in northern Mali.
